commits.subject: refactor: create reusable component library for results display
commits.body:
- Add lib/components with ResultPanel, ResultRow, ResultSection, InputField
- Add DeveloperResults, BuyerResults, TransferPricingResults components
- Add lib/utils with formatCurrency, formatPercent, getRiskBadgeClass helpers
- Refactor calculator page to use new components, reducing code by ~150 lines

The component library ensures consistent styling across all 6 model calculators
and simplifies maintenance.

commits.subject: feat: add model selector UI and fix TypeScript array access issues
commits.body:
- Add /structuring page with visual model cards for all 6 transaction models
- Add dynamic /structuring/[model] calculator page with inputs and results
- Fix TypeScript strict mode array access errors with ?? fallbacks
- Export all 6 models and sensitivity functions from calculator package

UI supports Model 1 (Cost-Plus) calculator with variant selection and
basic result display. Pages for Models 2-6 pending.

commits.subject: docs: update session notes with Phase 3 completion
feat: add sensitivity analysis module
commits.body:
- Add sensitivity/types.ts with TypeScript interfaces for ranges,
  scenarios, Monte Carlo, and chart data
- Add sensitivity/calculations.ts with:
  - Range creation (createRange, createInputRanges)
  - Scenario generation (best/base/worst case)
  - Input sensitivity analysis (calculateInputSensitivity)
  - Break-even analysis (findBreakEvenValue)
  - Monte Carlo simulation (runMonteCarloSimulation)
  - Statistical utilities (mean, median, percentiles, histogram)
  - Triangular distribution random number generation
  - Formatting utilities (currency, percentage)
- Export all sensitivity functions from main package index
- Add 40 comprehensive tests for sensitivity analysis

Total tests: 301 passing across 8 test files

commits.subject: feat: add projections module with NPV, IRR, payback calculations
commits.body:
- Add projections/types.ts with TypeScript interfaces
- Add projections/calculations.ts with:
  - NPV, present value, future value
  - IRR using Newton-Raphson method
  - MIRR with reinvestment rate
  - Simple and discounted payback period
  - Profitability index
  - ROI and annualized ROI
  - Investment assessment utility
  - Cash flow utilities
- Export projections from main package index
- Add 39 comprehensive tests for projections

Total tests: 261 passing across 7 test files

commits.subject: test: add comprehensive tests for Models 2-6
commits.body:
- Model 2 (Licence): 46 tests covering all 8 variants
- Model 3 (Joint Dev): 28 tests covering all 8 variants
- Model 4 (BOT): 32 tests covering all 8 variants
- Model 5 (Software Sale): 35 tests covering all 8 variants
- Model 6 (SaaS): 37 tests covering all 9 variants

Total: 222 tests across 6 models (all passing)

commits.subject: feat: extract Models 2-6 to TypeScript - Phase 2 complete
commits.body:
Complete extraction of all 6 transaction models (47 variants total):
- Model 2: Licence/Royalties (8 variants)
- Model 3: Joint Development (8 variants)
- Model 4: BOT (8 variants)
- Model 5: Software Sale (8 variants)
- Model 6: SaaS/Subscription (9 variants)

Each model includes:
- Full TypeScript type definitions
- Variant-specific input types
- Developer and Buyer perspective calculations
- Transfer pricing assessment
- Accounting treatment logic

Updated models index with unified exports and model registry.

commits.subject: feat: architecture redesign - Phase 1 foundation
commits.body:
Migrate from vanilla JS to TypeScript + SvelteKit monorepo architecture
for improved maintainability, type safety, and testability.

Changes:
- Add monorepo structure with pnpm workspaces
- Create @model-pear/calculator package with TypeScript
  - Extract Model 1 (Cost-Plus) with full type definitions
  - Add comprehensive test suite (44 tests)
  - Define types for entities, results, and calculations
- Create @model-pear/web SvelteKit app shell
  - Set up Tailwind CSS configuration
  - Add landing page with mode selector
  - Add proof-of-concept UI for Model 1
  - Configure static adapter for GitHub Pages
- Move existing vanilla JS code to legacy/ folder
- Add ARCHITECTURE.md documenting the redesign

Build commands:
- pnpm install: Install dependencies
- pnpm test: Run calculator tests
- pnpm build: Build all packages

This is Phase 1 of 4 in the migration plan.
Next: Extract Models 2-6 and projection calculations.
